intro: Cassebeeria hookeriana, commonly known as Hooker's cassebeer, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
